revised_title: Exploration of Colored Phenomena and Interference of Light
tldr: The author, Thomas Young, conducted experiments with fibers, plates, and light to study the production of colors and the interference of light. He discovered that the colors of fibers and mixed plates are caused by the interference of light, and that the intensity of the colors depends on the difference in the routes of the light. This work contributed to the understanding of the undulatory theory of light and the explanation of various optical phenomena.
